title: Retro Metal Detecting
description: Beep beep! How well do you remember the exciting hobby of metal detecting and treasure hunting?

questions.question: What popular brand of metal detectors, known for their reliability, was a favorite among hobbyists from the 1970s onward?
What feature on metal detectors helped users distinguish between different types of metal underground?
What small, handheld pointed tool did detectorists use to dig up targets from the ground?
options: A digging trowel or hand digger

questions.question: What term do metal detectorists use for the items they find underground?
What common unwanted find, made of iron, is the bane of every metal detectorist's outing?
options: Old nails and bottle caps (junk iron)

questions.question: What popular location for metal detecting often yielded old coins, buttons, and relics?
What did responsible metal detectorists always do after digging a hole to retrieve a target?
options: Mark the spot with a flag
Place a coin in the hole
Fill the hole back in (leaving no trace)

questions.question: What type of metal detecting was done at ocean beaches to find lost jewelry and coins?
What exciting sound from a metal detector indicated a potentially good target, as opposed to junk?
What pouch or bag did detectorists typically wear to collect their finds while out in the field?
What important etiquette rule did detectorists follow regarding private property?
options: Always get permission from the landowner before detecting
Leave all valuable finds for the owner

questions.question: What smaller, handheld metal detector was used to pinpoint the exact location of a target in a hole?
What was a 'coin shoot' in metal detecting?
options: A method of throwing coins to test a detector
An organized hunt where detectorists searched a seeded area for coins and prizes
A contest to see who could shoot a coin the farthest
A technique for cleaning found coins

questions.question: What circular part of the metal detector, swept close to the ground, sends and receives signals?
What did experienced detectorists consider the most thrilling type of find?
options: An old silver or gold coin, or a piece of jewelry
